name: Validators

values.name: isEmail
values.comment:
Return an `Err errorMessage` if the given string isn't correct an email address,
otherwise return `Ok value`.

values.name: isEqualTo
values.comment:
Validate Field

Return an `Err errorMessage` if the given value of `Field Valid a` isn't same as
validation argument, otherwise return `Ok validation argument` for others `Validity`
or for `Valid a` is `Ok value`.

    import Validation exposing (Validator, ErrorMessage, Field)

    pass : Field String String
    pass =
        Field "" (Valid "password*")

    confirmPasswordValidation : Validator String String
    confirmPasswordValidation =
        isEqualTo pass "The passwords don't match."

    confirmPasswordValidation "password*" -- Ok password*
    confirmPasswordValidation "pasword*"  -- Err "The passwords don't match."
values.type: Validation.Field raw a -> Validation.ErrorMessage -> Validation.Validator a a

values.name: isFloat
values.comment:
Return an `Err errorMessage` if the given value isn't float number, otherwise
return `Ok value`.

    import Validation exposing (Validator, ErrorMessage)

    floatValidation : Validator String Float
    floatValidation =
        isFloat "It is not float number!"

    floatValidation "5.39161" -- Ok 5.39161
    floatValidation "t.39161" -- Err "It is not float number!"

values.name: isInList
values.comment:
Return an `Err errorMessage` if the given value isn't in list, otherwise
return `Ok value`.

    import Validation exposing (Validator, ErrorMessage)

    elInListValidation : Validator (Int, List Int) Int
    elInListValidation =
        isInList "Given value is not in list!"

    elInListValidation (3, [1, 2, 3]) -- Ok 3
    elInListValidation (5, [1, 2, 3]) -- Err "Given value is not in list!"
values.type: Validation.ErrorMessage -> Validation.Validator ( a, List a ) a

values.name: isInt
values.comment:
Return an `Err errorMessage` if the given value isn't int number, otherwise
return `Ok value`.

    import Validation exposing (Validator, ErrorMessage)

    intValidation : Validator String Int
    intValidation =
        isInt "It is not int number!"

    intValidation "108" -- Ok 108
    intValidation "3.14" -- Err "It is not int number!"

values.name: isNotEmpty
values.comment:
Return an `Err errorMessage` if the given string is empty, otherwise
return `Ok value`.

values.name: isPositiveFloat
values.comment:
Return an `Err errorMessage` if the given value isn't positive float number,
otherwise return `Ok value`. It contains also float validation of value.

values.name: isPositiveInt
values.comment:
Return an `Err errorMessage` if the given value isn't positive int number,
otherwise return `Ok value`. It contains also int validation of value.

values.name: isTrue
values.comment:
Return an `Err errorMessage` if the given boolean value is false, otherwise
return `Ok True`.

values.name: isUrl
values.comment:
Return an `Err errorMessage` if the given string isn't correct an url path,
otherwise return `Ok value`.

values.name: isValidField
values.comment:
Return false if `Field` hasn't validity `Valid a`, otherwise
return true.

    import Validation exposing (Field, field, preValidatedField)

    intNotvalidValue = field "50"        -- Field "50" NotValidated
    intValidValue = preValidatedField 50 -- Field "50" (Valid 50)

    isValidField intNotvalidValue -- False
    isValidField intValidValue    -- True

name: Transformation

values.name: toModel
values.comment:
This function transforms form to model and returns an `Err errorMessage` if
any variable in the form is NotValidated either Invalid. Otherwise returns `Ok model`.
See examples above.
values.type: model -> (Transformation.Transformer model form -> Transformation.Transformer data form) -> form -> Result.Result String data

values.name: withField
values.comment:
This function is used to check if the given variable in the form has correct validity and
if yes, then returns this variable with her value. Otherwise returns an `Err errorMessage`.

    import Validation exposing (preValidatedField, Field)

    type A = A Int
    type B = B Float

    type alias Model = { a : A, b : B}
    type alias Form = { a : Field String Int, b : Field String Float}

    form = Form (preValidatedField 1) (preValidatedField 0.3)

    condPosInt : Int -> Result String A
    condPosInt val =
        if val > 0 then
            Ok (A val)
        else
            Err "Value must be positive number!!!"

    condFloatRange : Float -> Result String B
    condFloatRange val =
        if val < 10 && val > 0 then
            Ok (B val)
        else
            Err "Value isn't in range!!!"

    model : Result String Model
    model =
        toModel
            Model
            ( withField condPosInt .a
            >> withField condFloatRange .b
            )
            form

    -- Ok { a = 1, b = 0.3 }
values.type: (a -> Result.Result String b) -> (form -> Validation.Field raw a) -> Transformation.Transformer (b -> c) form -> Transformation.Transformer c form

values.name: withoutField
values.comment:
This function is similar to function above and is used for non-field type of variables.

    import Validation exposing (preValidatedField, Field)

    type Planet = Venus | Earth | Mars
    type alias Model = { planet : Planet, a: Int, b: Float}
    type alias Form = { planet : Planet, a : Field String Int, b : Field String Float}

    form = Form Earth (preValidatedField 1) (preValidatedField 0.3)
    --form = Form Mars (preValidatedField 1) (Validation.field "40.5")

    model : Result String Model
    model =
        let
            fieldOk = withField Ok
            valueOk = withoutField Ok
        in
            toModel
                Model
                ( valueOk .planet
                >> fieldOk .a
                >> fieldOk .b
                )
                form

    -- Ok { planet = Earth, a = 1, b = 0.3 }
    -- for form with Mars we get:
    --      Err "Form is invalid!!!",
    -- because validity of initial value b is NotValidated.
values.type: (a -> Result.Result String b) -> (form -> a) -> Transformation.Transformer (b -> c) form -> Transformation.Transformer c form

name: Validation

aliases.name: ErrorMessage
aliases.comment:
Represents error message for invalid values in input form.
This type is used for definition of validator functions.

aliases.name: OptionalField
aliases.comment:
Sometimes we want to use input form as optional, for example age.
In this case the input field can be an empty. But if somebody provides
input value then input field will be validated. So this type is used
for define optional variable.

aliases.name: Validator
aliases.comment: It's used for validate variables, see `Validators` for example.

types.name: Event
types.comment:
Event describe state of input form:
* `OnSubmit` validates model data before submitting to server,
see `validateModel` in `example`.
* `OnBlur` validates input form when user leaves an input field.
* `OnRelatedChange` validates input form which is tied with another form.
For example: password and confirm form.
* `OnChange raw` validates input form when user changes value in input field,

types.name: Field
types.comment:
Define data type.
For example:

    dist =
        Field 40.5 NotValidated

That means `dist` has value 40.5 which hasn't validated yet.

types.name: SubmissionStatus
types.comment:
Here `SubmissionStatus` define states for submit data to server:
* `NotSubmitted` means that data have not sent yet.
* `InProcess` for data being processed.
* `Succeeded` if data have been successfully received.
* `Failed` or vice versa, data have not been successfully received.

    This also may be used to inform user on screen, see `renderStatus`in `example`.

types.name: Validity
types.comment:
This type defines three state of Field:
* `NotValidated` values e.g. in input from, which have not validated yet.
* `Valid a` values that they are correct.
* `Invalid String` and state for incorrect input values.

values.comment:
Composition of two Validators.

    import Validators exposing (isNotEmpty, isEmail)

    emailValidation : Validator String String
    emailValidation =
        isNotEmpty "An email is required."
            >&& isEmail "Please ensure this is a valid email."
values.type: Validation.Validator a b -> Validation.Validator b c -> Validation.Validator a c

values.name: extractError
values.comment:
Extract error message from Field.

    import Validaton exposing (Field)

    errorLabel : Field raw a -> Html Msg
    errorLabel field =
        div []
            [ field
                |> extractError
                |> Maybe.withDefault ""
                |> text
            ]

values.name: field
values.comment:
Default setting of Field with `NotValidated` validity.

    import Validation exposing (Field, field)

    intValue : Field String String
    intValue =
        field "50"


    -- Field "50" NotValidated

values.name: optional
values.comment:
Validation of optional variable.

    import Validaton exposing (Event(..), OptionalField, field, validate)
    import Validators exposing (isPositiveInt)

    age : OptionalField String Int
    age =
        field ""

    validate
        OnSubmit
        (optional (isPositiveInt "The age has to be positive number."))
        age

    -- Field "" (Valid Nothing)
values.type: Validation.Validator String a -> Validation.Validator String (Maybe.Maybe a)

values.name: preValidatedField
values.comment:
Default setting of Field with `Valid a` validity.

    import Validation exposing (Field, field)

    intValue : Field String Int
    intValue =
        preValidatedField "50"


    -- Field "50" (Valid 50)

values.name: rawValue
values.comment:
Get value from Field.

    import Validation exposing (Field)

    intValue : Field String String
    intValue =
        Field "50" NotValidated

    rawValue intValue       -- "50"

values.name: validate
values.comment: Run validation on Field with `Event`.
values.type: Validation.Event raw -> Validation.Validator raw a -> Validation.Field raw a -> Validation.Field raw a

values.name: validity
values.comment:
Get validity from Field.

    import Validation exposing (Field)

    intValue : Field String Int
    intValue =
        Field "50" (Valid 50)

    validity intValue       -- Valid 50

Applying function to particular validation. For instance, see `submitIfValid` and
`submit` function in `example`.
values.type: Validation.Validity (a -> b) -> Validation.Validity a -> Validation.Validity b
